en: He had trouble breathing.
He was sent for and had to go.
He is as great an artist as lived.
ko: 그는 역사상 그 어떤 예술가 못지않게 위대해.

en: He is as great a scientist as ever lived.
ko: 그는 역사상 그 어떤 과학자 못지않게 위대해.

en: He is as great a statesman as ever lived.
ko: 그는 역사상 그 어떤 정치가 못지않게 위대해.

en: He chanced on a rare book at a second-hand bookstore.
He is a man with a classical education.
He wrote a novel based on ancient myths.
ko: 그는 고대 신화를 바탕으로 소설을 썼어.

en: He is well acquainted with ancient history.
ko: 그는 고대사에 대해 아주 잘 알아.

en: He likes collecting old coins.
ko: 그는 옛날 동전 수집하는 걸 좋아해.

en: He is as great a poet as ever lived.
ko: 그는 역사상 그 어떤 시인 못지않게 위대해.

en: He is the greatest architect that has ever lived.
He is the greatest statesman that ever lived.
He cast his old friends aside.
He turned his back on the old tradition.
He turned his back on the old traditions.
He exchanged his old car for a new one.
ko: 그는 헌 차를 새 차로 바꿨어.

en: He traded his old car in for a new one.
ko: 그는 타던 차를 넘기고 새 차로 바꿨어.

en: He wore old shoes.
He was playing football with an old tin.
ko: 그는 낡은 깡통으로 축구를 하고 있었어.

en: He was playing football with an empty can.
ko: 그는 빈 깡통으로 축구를 하고 있었어.

en: He had the old machine fixed.
He disposed of his old house.
He is dressed in an old tweed suit.
ko: 그는 낡은 트위드 정장을 입고 있어.

en: He found an old, broken chair and sat down at the piano.
ko: 그는 낡고 부서진 의자를 찾아서 피아노 앞에 앉았어.

en: He has a strong personality.
He tends to place more stress on society in general than on individual.
ko: 그는 개인보다 사회 전체를 더 중요하게 생각하는 편이야.

en: He is brief of speech.
He is a man of few words, but he always keeps his promise.
ko: 그는 말수는 적지만 약속은 꼭 지켜.

en: He chose his words carefully.
He has the faculty to learn languages easily.
ko: 그는 언어를 쉽게 배우는 능력이 있어.

en: He didn't know how to express himself.
ko: 그는 자신을 어떻게 표현해야 할지 몰랐어.

en: He chose every word with care.
His actions do not correspond with his words.
He tried to speak by word or gesture.
ko: 그는 말이나 몸짓으로 의사 표현을 하려고 했어.

en: He got himself committed to it.
His deeds didn't agree with his words.
His words don't line up with his actions.
He is kind in word and deed.
He has a great knowledge of the linguistic field.
ko: 그는 언어학 분야에 지식이 아주 많아.

en: He is absorbed in the study of linguistics.
ko: 그는 언어학 연구에 푹 빠져 있어.

en: He is at home in phonetics as well as linguistics.
He did what he was told.
He did what he had been told; otherwise he would have been scolded.
ko: 그는 시키는 대로 했어, 안 그랬으면 혼났을 거야.

en: He had no choice but to do as he was told.
ko: 그는 시키는 대로 할 수밖에 없었어.

en: He came early, as he had been asked to do.
He did it as he had been told.
He did what he had been told.
He took back everything he said.
ko: 걔 자기가 한 말 다 취소했어.

en: He failed to do what he said he would do.
ko: 걔 한다고 했던 거 결국 못 했어.

en: He failed to do what he said.
He said, I am not.
He forgot part of his speech and had to ad-lib for a while.
ko: 걔 연설하다가 중간에 까먹어서 한동안 애드리브 쳤어.

en: He went so far as to hit the girl to make her obey his orders.
ko: 걔는 말을 듣게 하려고 그 여자애를 때리기까지 했어.

en: He had nothing to say, so he went away.
ko: 걔 할 말 없어서 그냥 갔어.

en: He had nothing to say, so he left.
ko: 걔 딱히 할 말 없어서 그냥 가버렸어.

en: He began to make excuses.
He is inventive of excuses.
He said a few words by way of apology.
He is clever at making excuses.
ko: 걔 변명 하나는 기가 막히게 잘해.

en: He was welcomed by the people there.
He studies contemporary literature.
He gave an interesting broadcast about modern art.
ko: 걔 현대 미술에 대해서 되게 재밌게 방송하더라.

en: He dwelt on the complexities of modern life.
ko: 걔는 현대 생활이 얼마나 복잡한지에 대해서 길게 말했어.

en: He is hailed as the father of modern anthropology.
Modern music is familiar to him.
He has a liking for modern music.
He is at home in modern English literature.
ko: 걔 현대 영문학은 완전 꽉 잡고 있어.

en: He is one of the best singers of the day.
ko: 걔 요즘 제일 잘나가는 가수 중 한 명이야.

en: He's the Bach of today.
He is a Newton of our day.
ko: 걔는 우리 시대의 뉴턴 같은 사람이야.

en: He is a Chopin for our times.
He is the greatest living artist.
He deeply deplored the situation.
ko: 걔 그 상황에 대해서 진짜 유감이라고 하더라.

en: He is in the hospital at present.
He's in the hospital right now.
ko: 걔 지금 바로 병원에 입원해 있어.

en: He is well off now.
It seems that he likes his present job.
ko: 걔 지금 하는 일 마음에 들어 하는 것 같아.

en: He is not content with his present salary.
ko: 걔 지금 월급에 만족 못 하고 있어.

en: He is living in an apartment at present.
He didn't say anything as to whether he was going to pay in cash or by check.
ko: 현금으로 낼지 수표로 낼지 걔 아무 말도 안 하더라.

en: He is almost professional.
He darted into the hall and up the stairs.
ko: 걔 복도로 휙 들어가서 계단으로 뛰어 올라갔어.

en: He saw a dog near the door.
ko: 걔 문 근처에서 강아지 한 마리 봤대.

en: He is having a hard time losing weight.
He advocated reduction of taxes.
He advocated the reduction of taxes.
He erred on the side of severity.
ko: 걔는 너무 엄격하게 하다가 실수를 좀 했어.

en: Though he dieted, he still remained too fat.
He looks stern, but actually he's very kind.
ko: 걔 무서워 보이는데 사실 되게 착해.

en: He is at once strict and tender.
He was subjected to severe criticism.
He was subjected to severe trials.
He is advised to go on a strict diet.
ko: 걔 식단 조절 좀 빡세게 하래.

en: He cannot put up with hard training.
He is at once stern and tender.
He is strict yet kind.
He established a friendly relationship with the natives.
He is writing the manuscript over and over again.
ko: 걔 원고를 계속 다시 쓰고 있어.

en: He has galvanized back to life.
He adhered to the original plan.
He stuck to the original plan.
It seems that he's fine.
It seemed that he was fine.
He entered into the game with great spirit.
He looks well.
He looked well.
He is full of go.
He is not so healthy as he used to be.
He stared at the steep slope.
He was looking through a microscope.
He looked for the key.
He searched for the key.
He put the key in the lock.
He found his key and opened the door.
He tried in vain to open the locked door.
ko: 걔 잠긴 문을 열려고 애썼지만 소용없었어.

en: He fished in the drawer for the key.
He locked up his jewels in the safe.
He searched his pockets for the key.
He has acted wisely.
He is not wise but clever.
He is a sage.
He is more clever than wise.
He doesn't appear to be wise, does he?
Though he's not clever, he's a diligent worker.
He looks like a clever boy.
He's too smart to do something that stupid.
ko: 걔는 그렇게 바보 같은 짓을 할 정도로 멍청하지 않아.

en: He is more crafty than wise.
Clever as he is, he still cannot solve this math problem.
ko: 걔가 아무리 똑똑해도 이 수학 문제는 못 풀어.

en: He is clever but tricky.
Just because he's wise doesn't mean that he's honest.
ko: 걔가 지혜롭다고 해서 꼭 정직한 건 아니야.

en: He wrote away for a sample.
He is a well informed person.
He has become thin beyond all recognition.
ko: 걔 못 알아볼 정도로 살이 빠졌어.

en: He has too many wild ideas.
He could not accept a strange woman as his mother.
ko: 걔는 모르는 여자를 엄마로 받아들일 수 없었어.

en: He couldn't accept a strange woman as his mother.
ko: 걔는 낯선 여자를 엄마로 받아들일 수 없었어.

en: He learned golf by watching others and following their example.
ko: 걔 남들 하는 거 보고 따라 하면서 골프 배웠어.

en: He ran away lest he should be seen.
He was fixed in admiration.
He reported to them what he had seen.
ko: 걔 자기가 본 걸 그 사람들한테 보고했어.

en: He is no stranger to me.
He is much older than he looks.
He is not as simple as he seems.
He is not as young as he looks.
He is not as old as he seems.
He isn't as stupid as he looks.
Though apparently healthy, he really has a delicate constitution.
ko: 걔 겉보기엔 건강해 보여도 실제로는 몸이 약해.

en: He is not what he seems.
He has broad shoulders.
He is not like he seems.
He has narrow shoulders.
He looked back over his shoulder.
He was wounded in the shoulder.
He was walking with his shoulders squared.
He shrugged his shoulders.
He carried a rifle on his shoulder.
He looked backward over his shoulder.
He keeps some mice for the purpose of studying.
ko: 걔 연구하려고 쥐 몇 마리 키워.

en: He expanded his research.
He is preoccupied with his studies.
His study absorbs him.
He is absorbed in study.
He is deep in study.
He dedicates himself to research.
He went about making a doghouse.
He traveled with only a dog for company.
He went out for a walk with his dog.
He tied the dog to a tree.
He beat the dog with a stick.
He is afraid of dogs.
He's afraid of dogs.
He's scared of dogs.
He let the dog loose in the garden.
He let the dog loose in the yard.
He is much afraid of dogs.
He is very afraid of dogs.
He went about the town looking for the dog.
He went out for a walk, with his dog following behind.
ko: 걔 개가 뒤에서 따라오는 채로 산책 나갔어.

en: Does he have a dog?
He kept three dogs but lost one of them because of a traffic accident.
ko: 걔 개 세 마리 키웠는데 한 마리는 교통사고로 잃었어.

en: He found a good companion in his dog.
He has two dogs.
I like dogs better than cats.
He gave the dog a bone.
He heard the dog barking.
He has one dog and six cats.
ko: 걔 개 한 마리랑 고양이 여섯 마리 키워.

en: He has a dog and six cats.
ko: 걔 개 한 마리랑 고양이 여섯 마리 있어.

en: He's power-hungry.
He struck me in the face with his fist.
He delegated his authority to his competent assistant.
ko: 걔 유능한 조수한테 권한을 다 맡겼어.

en: He succumbed to authority.
He exercised his powers to the full.
He is full of ambition for power.
He worked very hard, but could make little progress.
ko: 걔 진짜 열심히 일했는데 진전이 거의 없었어.

en: He worked hard, until he fell ill.
He worked hard only to fail.
He went to the back of the building.
He shook his head as if to say "No".
He's a really straight-laced guy, so he doesn't like the idea of his son changing jobs.
ko: 그 사람은 엄청 고지식해서 아들이 이직하는 걸 안 좋아해.

en: He was determined, and we couldn't bend him.
ko: 고집이 너무 세서 우리도 꺾을 수가 없었어.

en: He is an aggressive person.
He was killed with a sword.
He was compelled to resign on account of ill health.
ko: 건강이 안 좋아서 어쩔 수 없이 사임했어.

en: He was in despair over health problems.
He stopped working due to health concerns.
He is beginning to pick up his health again.
He forfeited his health.
He succeeded in business at the cost of his health.
He worked hard at the risk of his health.
He did duty at the expense of his health.
He did his duty at the cost of his health.
He wanted to succeed, even at the cost of his health.
He finished the work at the expense of his health.
He finished the job at the expense of his health.
He retired because of the loss of his health.
He got well again.
He has given up smoking for the sake of his health.
He quit smoking for the sake of his health.
He gave up drinking for the sake of his health.
He moved to a warmer place for the sake of his health.
ko: 건강을 위해 좀 더 따뜻한 곳으로 이사했어.

en: He stopped smoking for the improvement of his health.
He stopped smoking for the sake of his health.
His health has enabled him to succeed in life.
ko: 건강한 덕분에 사회에서 성공할 수 있었어.

en: His health enables him to work so hard.
ko: 건강하니까 그렇게 열심히 일할 수 있는 거야.

en: In addition to good health, he has a good brain.
He enjoys good health.
He looks healthy.
He seems healthy.
He seems to be in good health.
He wishes to resign on the grounds that his health is failing.
ko: 건강이 안 좋아졌다는 이유로 그만두고 싶어 해.

en: He declined in health.
He has recovered his health, so he is now able to resume his studies.
ko: 건강을 회복해서 이제 다시 공부할 수 있게 됐어.

en: He is an economizer.
He went to New York on Monday.
He often cuts classes on Monday and Saturday.
He works from Monday to Friday.
He was the first man to land on the moon.
ko: 그 사람이 달에 처음으로 발을 내디딘 사람이야.

en: He fell for that old ad for a house like a ton of bricks.
ko: 그 낡은 집 광고에 홀딱 속아 넘어갔어.

en: He will have spent all his money by the end of the month.
ko: 이번 달 말이면 돈을 다 써버릴 거야.

en: His monthly salary is no less than 500,000 yen.
He is not worth his salt.
He has a monthly income of 2,000 dollars.
He stood on the surface of the moon.
He goes to London once a month.
ko: 한 달에 한 번 런던에 가.

en: He never fails to write home once a month.
ko: 한 달에 한 번은 꼭 집에 편지를 써.

en: He gets a haircut three times a month.
ko: 한 달에 세 번 머리를 잘라.

en: He earns 300,000 yen a month.
He plays golf two or three times a month.
ko: 걔는 한 달에 두세 번 골프 쳐.

en: He saved the dying child by giving his blood.
ko: 걔가 수혈해 줘서 죽어가던 애를 살렸어.

en: He shuddered at the sight of blood.
He made a speech at the wedding feast.
He was white-lipped.
He is not the man he was before he married.
He's not the man he was before he got married.
He is pussyfooting around on our marriage.
ko: 걔 우리 결혼 문제로 자꾸 미적거려.

en: He used to play football before his marriage.
ko: 걔 결혼하기 전에는 축구 하곤 했어.

en: He was married and settled down.
He is related to me by marriage.
He was happily married.
He is unmarried.
He has become another man since getting married.
I wonder if he is married.
He is married with two children.
He is related to her by marriage.
He's a tenacious guy who always manages to come out on top. He's the kind of guy who can turn any situation to his advantage.
ko: 걔 진짜 끈질겨서 결국엔 꼭 이기더라고. 어떤 상황이든 자기한테 유리하게 만드는 스타일이야.

en: He will come after all.
He was right after all.
He failed after all.
In the end, he did not come.
He did not turn up after all.
He didn't turn up after all.
He didn't pass after all.
He did not appear at all, which made her very uneasy.
ko: 걔가 끝내 안 나타나서 그 여자애가 되게 불안해했어.

en: He finally had to step down.
He seemed disappointed at the results.
He seemed disappointed with the results.
He is satisfied with the result.
He may dread to learn the results.
ko: 걔 결과 알게 되는 거 되게 무서워할지도 몰라.

en: He dug a hole.
He turned out to be innocent.
He stared a hole through her.
He explained at length what had been decided.
ko: 걔가 결정된 내용을 길게 설명해 줬어.

en: He lacks decisiveness.
He is lacking in decisiveness.
He can't make a decision.
He is slow to decide, but he is quick to act.
He was persuaded to change his mind.
He changed his mind.
He has a reputation for taking a long time to make a decision.
ko: 걔 결정 내리는 데 한참 걸리기로 유명해.

en: He has a reputation for taking a long time to make up his mind.
ko: 걔 마음 정하는 데 시간 되게 오래 걸린다고 소문났어.

en: He never goes against his parents.
ko: 걔는 부모님 말씀을 거역하는 법이 없어.

en: He will never live up to his parent's expectations.
ko: 걔 부모님 기대에 절대 못 미칠 거야.

en: He never gave in to temptation.
He never gave way to temptation.
He is by no means wanting in courage.
ko: 걔가 결코 용기가 없는 게 아니야.

en: He is not entirely without courage.
ko: 걔가 아주 용기가 없는 건 아니야.

en: He is certainly not without courage.
ko: 걔 확실히 용기 없는 건 아니야.

en: He is the last person to break his promise.
ko: 걔는 절대 약속을 어길 사람이 아니야.

en: He will never break his promise.
ko: 걔는 절대 약속 안 어길 거야.

en: He never breaks his promise.
He never breaks his promises.
He is the last man to break his promise.
I am of the opinion that he will never come back.
ko: 걔는 절대 안 돌아올 것 같아.

en: I think he will never come back.
He never goes out late at night.
He is no ordinary student.
He never borrows nor lends things.
He is far from poor, in fact he has a lot of money.
ko: 걔 전혀 안 가난해, 사실 돈 진짜 많아.

en: He is by no means stupid.
He will on no account accept defeat.
ko: 걔는 어떤 일이 있어도 패배를 인정 안 할 거야.

en: He never looks down on poor people.
ko: 걔는 가난한 사람들을 절대 무시 안 해.

en: He is by no means bright.
He never gets up early in the morning.
ko: 걔는 아침에 일찍 일어나는 법이 없어.

en: He never looks down upon others.
He makes a point of never speaking ill of others.
ko: 걔는 남 험담을 절대 안 하려고 해.

en: He makes it a rule never to speak badly of others.
ko: 걔는 남 욕 안 하는 게 철칙이야.

en: He never puts off anything he has to do.
ko: 걔는 할 일을 절대 안 미뤄.

en: He will never yield to the pressure of a politician.
ko: 걔는 정치인의 압력에 절대 굴하지 않을 거야.

en: In no way is he a man of character.
ko: 걔는 절대 인격자라고 할 수 없지.

en: He is the last person to pay out of his own pocket.
ko: 걔는 자기 돈은 절대 안 쓸 사람이야.

en: He is by no means kind.
He is definitely not a gentleman.
He never looked back.
He is anything but a reliable man.
ko: 걔는 도저히 믿을 만한 사람이 아니야.

en: He never breaks his habit.
He never boasted of his success.
ko: 걔는 자기 성공을 절대 자랑하지 않았어.

en: He never speaks of his own job.
ko: 걔는 자기 일 얘기를 전혀 안 해.

en: He never made a display of his learning.
ko: 걔는 아는 체를 전혀 안 했어.

en: He never makes a show of his learning.
ko: 걔는 아는 척을 절대 안 해.

en: He will never admit his fault.
ko: 걔는 절대 자기 잘못 인정 안 할 거야.

en: It may safely be said that he will never succeed in business.
ko: 걔는 사업에서 절대 성공 못 한다고 봐도 돼.

en: He is the last man to deceive me.
People say he never dies.
He was by no means happy.
He is far from happy.
He never lay down under the power.
ko: 걔는 권력 앞에 절대 굴복하지 않았어.

en: He would be the last man to steal money.
ko: 걔가 돈을 훔칠 사람이 절대 아니야.

en: He never loses hope.
He never seems to feel the cold.
ko: 걔는 추위를 전혀 안 타는 것 같아.

en: He is anything but a scholar.
He is far from a scholar.
He is the last man to tell a lie.
He is the last person to tell a lie.
He never tells lies.
He never lies.
He never counts on my help.
ko: 걔는 내 도움을 전혀 기대 안 해.

en: He is the last man to take a bribe.
ko: 걔는 뇌물 받을 사람이 절대 아니야.

en: He is anything but a good student.
He is anything but handsome.
I am sure he would be the last person to do it.
ko: 걔가 그런 짓을 할 애는 절대 아니에요.

en: He is above doing such a thing.
ko: 걔는 그런 짓 할 사람이 아니에요.

en: He never tells a lie.
He is anything but a liar.
He never appears before nine o'clock.
He is a mass of faults.
He is liked by all even though he has his faults.
ko: 걔는 단점이 좀 있어도 다들 좋아해요.

en: With all his faults, he is respected by everybody.
I like him all the better for his faults.
ko: 걔는 단점이 있어서 더 정이 가요.

en: He excused his absence.
ko: 걔는 안 온 거에 대해 변명하더라고요.

en: He gave an explanation about why he had been absent.
ko: 걔가 왜 빠졌는지 이유를 설명해 줬어요.

en: He gave an excuse about why he had been absent.
He was apologetic for being absent.
ko: 걔는 빠진 거에 대해 미안해하는 기색이었어요.

en: He choked with rage.
ko: 걔는 화가 치밀어서 말도 못 했어요.

en: He was bursting with fury.
He left the room in a rage.
He was trembling with rage.
ko: 걔는 너무 화가 나서 부들부들 떨더라고요.

en: He resisted arrest violently.
ko: 걔는 잡힐 때 엄청 격렬하게 저항했어요.

en: He was attacked by a sharp pain in his stomach.
ko: 걔는 갑자기 배가 너무 아파서 쩔쩔맸어요.

en: He won a dramatic success.
He is familiar with the entertainment world.
He made good as an entertainer.
Since he's in show business he often goofs around in a showy way, but once in a while he has these bashful mannerisms that are really cute.
ko: 걔가 연예계에 있다 보니 가끔 까불거릴 때도 있는데, 문득 수줍어하는 모습이 진짜 귀엽더라고요.

en: He was raised in an artistic family.
He fancies himself as an artist.
He realized his dream of becoming an artist.
He has great ability as an artist.
He is proud that he is an artist.
ko: 걔는 자기가 예술가라는 거에 자부심이 있어요.

en: He boasts himself an artist.
He's proud to be an artist.
He contributed a lot of money for the sake of art.
He has a good eye for art.
He is not interested in art at all.
He has very little, if any, knowledge about art.
ko: 걔는 예술에 대해서는 거의 아는 게 없어요.

en: He had a reputation for carelessness.
He curled his lip in a sneer.
He is the chief of a police station.
As soon as he caught sight of a policeman, he ran away.
He ran at the sight of the policeman.
He is suited for police work.
ko: 걔는 경찰 일이 딱 적성에 맞아요.

en: He took to his heels when he saw a policeman.
He was in dead earnest when he threatened to call the police.
ko: 걔가 경찰 부른다고 협박할 땐 진짜 진심이었어요.

en: He fell under the suspicion of the police.
He is hunted by the police.
He's wanted by the police.
He was caught by the police.
I heard that he gave himself up to the police.
He notified the police of the traffic accident.
ko: 걔가 교통사고 난 걸 경찰에 신고했어요.

en: He gave the police a false name and address.
ko: 그는 경찰한테 가짜 이름이랑 주소를 알려줬어요.

en: He made a false statement to the police.
He has been looked for by the police.
He was subjected to torture by the police.
He got off with a warning.
When he saw the policeman, he ran away.
As soon as he saw a policeman, he ran away.
He ran away at the sight of a policeman.
He ran away when he saw the policeman.
As soon as he saw the policeman, he ran away.
He ran away at the sight of the policeman.
He was taken away by a policeman.
He got away disguised as a policeman.
He suddenly took a defiant attitude toward the police officer.
ko: 그는 갑자기 경찰한테 반항적인 태도를 보였어요.

en: He's good at arithmetic.
He is quick at figures.
He is expert at figures.
He never makes a plan without putting it into practice.
He carried out the plan.
He persisted in his project.
ko: 그는 자기 프로젝트를 끝까지 밀고 나갔어요.

en: He explained his plan both to my son and to me.
ko: 그는 내 아들이랑 나한테 자기 계획을 설명해 줬어요.

en: He gave me a brief outline of the plan.
ko: 그는 나한테 계획의 개요를 짧게 말해 줬어요.

en: He is an accountant at the company.
He accomplished the work as planned.
He is not economically independent of his parents.
ko: 그는 아직 부모님한테서 경제적으로 독립하지 못했어요.

en: His economical backing is secure.
He became financially independent.
He relies on his wife financially.
He gave up the plan for economic reasons.
ko: 그는 경제적인 이유로 그 계획을 포기했어요.

en: He is in his element when talking economics.
ko: 그는 경제 얘기를 할 때 아주 신이 나요.

en: He is a great authority on economics.
He made a substantial contribution to economics.
ko: 그는 경제학 발전에 큰 공헌을 했어요.

en: He contributed much to the development of the economy.
He has much economic knowledge.
He is an expert in economics.
He flatters himself that he is second to none in finance.
ko: 그는 자기가 금융 쪽에서는 최고라고 자부해요.

en: He is an experienced teacher.
He worked hard to make up for his lack of experience.
ko: 그는 부족한 경험을 채우려고 열심히 노력했어요.

en: He failed for want of experience.
He failed in business for lack of experience.
He lacks experience.
He is lacking in experience.
He has both experience and knowledge.
ko: 그는 지식과 경험을 모두 갖추고 있어요.

en: He is destitute of experiences.
He is doing very well considering he lacks experience.
ko: 경험이 부족한 것치고는 아주 잘하고 있어요.

en: He does well considering that he has no experience.
ko: 경험이 없는 걸 생각하면 잘하는 편이에요.

en: The experience gave him an advantage over the others.
ko: 그 경험 덕분에 그는 다른 사람들보다 유리해졌어요.

en: He arrived here just now.
He has just arrived here.
He decided to perform systematic research.
He commented that the economy was likely to get better.
ko: 걔가 경기가 좋아질 것 같다고 말하더라.

en: He did me the compliment of listening.
He stuck the notice on the board with tacks.
As soon as he graduated from Keio University, he took over his family's business.
ko: 걔는 게이오 대학 졸업하자마자 가업을 이어받았어.

en: Does he have any brothers?
He ran faster than his brother did.
He is less clever than his elder brother.
He is not as smart as his older brother.
He is not as intelligent as his older brother.
He is not as clever as my brother.
He is less diligent than his brother.
He took part in the meeting in place of his brother.
He made up for the sins of his brother.
He was standing by his brother.
He isn't less clever than his brother.
He is not less bright than his brother.
He ran to catch up to his brother.
He looks for all the world like his brother.
He looks exactly like his older brother.
He looks exactly like his brother.
He was anxious for his brother to meet you.
ko: 걔는 형이 너를 만나보기를 간절히 바랐어.

en: He grappled with his brother.
He is not as tall as his brother.
He is less patient than his brother.
He got angry with his brother.
He differs from his brother.
He satisfied me that his brother was innocent.
ko: 걔는 형이 무죄라는 걸 나한테 확인시켜 줬어.

en: He convinced me that his brother was innocent.
He was sent to prison.
He was put in prison.
He is an authority on criminal law.
He is a detective.
He is on duty.
He's in military service.
He was discharged from the army.
He received an honorable discharge from the army.
He was drafted into the army.
He cruised his way through the crowd.
ko: 걔는 사람들 사이를 슥슥 헤치고 나갔어.

en: He pushed his way through the crowd.
He muscled his way through the crowd.
ko: 걔는 사람들 사이를 억지로 비집고 들어갔어.

en: He disappeared into the crowd.
He passed among the crowd.
He battled his way out of the mob.
He was surrounded by the crowd.
He addressed the crowd gravely.
He went so far as to call you a fool.
He has a grudge against you.
I thought he loved you, but as it is, he loved another girl.
ko: 걔가 널 사랑하는 줄 알았는데, 사실은 다른 여자를 좋아하더라고.

en: He may have misunderstood you.
He's a little taller than you are.
ko: 걔가 너보다 키가 조금 더 커.

en: He's stronger than you.
He's much taller than you.
He is not so tall as you.
He's not as tall as you are.
He asked after you.
He was greatly amused at your suggestion.
He was amused at your suggestion.
He begrudges you your success.
He has no intention to interfere with your business.
ko: 걔 네 일에 참견할 생각 없어.

en: He listens to whatever you say.
ko: 걔는 네가 하는 말은 다 들어.

en: He was asking about your health.
He is putting on an act for you.
He'll lend you his book.
He went as far as to call you a hypocrite.
He says he has a bone to pick with you.
ko: 걔가 너한테 따질 게 좀 있대.

en: He asked me to communicate his wishes to you.
It is not that he's angry with you.
He is angry with you.
He's very angry with you.
He was scared you would shoot him.
ko: 걔는 네가 총 쏠까 봐 겁냈어.

en: He knows better than to lend you money.
ko: 걔가 너한테 돈 빌려줄 정도로 바보는 아니야.

en: He'll be glad to see you.
Did he tell you what to do?
Is he kind to you?
Did he acquaint you with the facts?
He runs as fast as you.
He can run as fast as you.
ko: 걔도 너만큼 빨리 달릴 수 있어.

en: He wants you to stay here.
He will object to your going abroad.
ko: 걔가 너 해외 나가는 거 반대할 거야.

en: He is eager that you come tomorrow.
ko: 걔는 네가 내일 꼭 왔으면 해.

en: He is a man whom I think you cannot trust.
ko: 걔는 내가 보기에 네가 믿을 만한 사람이 아니야.

en: He wants a watch like yours.
ko: 걔도 너 같은 시계 갖고 싶어 해.

en: He is not such a fool as you assumed him to be.
He wonders if you are afraid of snakes.
He'll do whatever you ask him to.
ko: 걔는 네가 시키는 건 다 할 거야.

en: He kept on telling the same story over and over.
He ran for his life when the bear appeared.
ko: 곰이 나타나니까 걔 살려고 죽어라 뛰더라.

en: He had his socks on inside out.
He had one of his socks on inside out.
He runs a shoe shop.
He leaned over to put on his shoes.
He stooped to put on his shoes.
He stooped down to put on his shoes.
He bought a pair of shoes.
It happened that he found the treasure.
He found his lost camera by chance.
He saw the scene by accident.
He overheard the conversation by accident.
ko: 걔가 어쩌다 그 대화를 엿듣게 됐어.

en: He came across this old coin in an antique shop.
ko: 걔가 골동품 가게에서 이 오래된 동전을 우연히 발견했어.

en: He has changed his mind about going abroad by air.
ko: 걔 비행기 타고 해외 가는 거 마음 바꿨어.

en: He left for America by air.

ko: 배고프고 지쳐서 쓰러졌는데, 좀 있다가 정신 차렸어.

en: He was so hungry that he didn't hesitate to eat everything on the plate.
ko: 너무 배고파서 접시에 있는 걸 망설임 없이 다 먹어 치웠어.

en: Hunger urged him to steal.
He tried to make up for lost time.
He is no more than a dreamer.
He got ideas into his head.
He lives in a world of fantasy.
He went to the airport to see his friend off.
He called his mother up from the airport.
He likes to relax at home with his family when he is on leave from the Air Force.
ko: 공군 휴가 나오면 집에서 가족들이랑 쉬는 걸 좋아해.

en: He stood looking at the sky.
He was looking at the sky.
Fool as he is, he knows how to make money.
ko: 바보 같아도 돈 버는 법은 알더라.

en: He was silly enough to believe her.
He was foolish enough to believe her.
He was foolish enough to believe what she said.
ko: 바보같이 걔가 한 말을 다 믿어버렸어.

en: He was stupid enough to believe her.
He was stupid enough to believe what she said.
ko: 멍청하게 걔가 한 말을 곧이곧대로 믿었어.

en: He was foolish to agree to the plan.
ko: 그 계획에 찬성한 건 어리석은 짓이었어.

en: He was too foolish to avoid making such errors.
ko: 너무 멍청해서 그런 실수를 피할 수가 없었어.

en: He pretended to be a stupid man.
He lived a life full of worries.
He accumulated his fortune by hard work.
He has managed to secure several accounts.
He took pains to write this song.

en: He made nothing of hardship.
He was impatient under his sufferings.
He held back a cry of agony.
He's out of his mind with pain.
He was very badly situated.
Somehow he managed to work his way through college.
He was in agony.
He has set off for Kyushu.
He has left for Kyushu.
He had a bitter experience.
He said, "It's nine o'clock."
He lives in a small village in Kyushu.
He has plenty of money in the bank.
He is in the banking line.
He learned his trade as a banker in London.
He gets a reasonable salary as a bank clerk.
ko: 은행원 치고는 월급을 꽤 잘 받아.

en: He is a bank clerk.
He's the president of the bank.
He went into the bank.
He has a large borrowing from finance banks.
He had a lot of money in the bank.
He paid his loan back to the bank.
He went to the bank and changed his money.
He is employed in a bank.
He has a lot of money in the bank.

He works at the bank.
He works at a bank.
He works in a bank.
He borrowed a lot of money from the bank.
He settled his account with the bank.
He got a loan from the bank.

ko: 은나무가 있는 황금 도시에 대한 신비로운 이야기를 들었대요.

en: You can make book on it that he won't help you.
ko: 그 사람이 너 안 도와줄 거라는 거에 내기해도 좋아.

en: He is generous with his money.

ko: 경제 흐름 분석을 잘하기로 소문난 금융 분석가예요.

en: He thinks of nothing but making money.
He was so intent on money-making that he had no time to think of anything else.
ko: 돈 버는 데만 너무 집중해서 다른 건 생각할 겨를이 없었어요.

en: He thinks only of making money.
He deals in hardware.
He has blond hair.
He's blond.
He got on a train bound for Kanazawa.
He is careless about money.
He seems to be rich.
He married a rich girl.
He was born rich.
It seems that he is rich.
He makes believe he is rich.
He looked like a rich man.
He's rich, but he lives like a beggar.
For all his wealth, he was still unhappy.
For all his wealth, he lives a simple life.
He has not become rich, but he had a certain measure of success.
ko: 부자가 된 건 아니지만, 어느 정도 성공은 했어요.

en: He worked day and night so that he might become rich.
He wanted to be rich.
He sought to be rich and famous.
With all his wealth, he is not happy.
Even though he's wealthy, he isn't happy.
Even though he's wealthy, he's not happy.
For all his riches he is not happy.
He longs for the fellowship of the rich.
He's not rich or able.
ko: 부자도 아니고 능력 있는 것도 아니에요.

en: He's not rich, but he's happy.
If he is not rich, he is at any rate happy.
He is not rich. On the contrary, he is deep in debt.
ko: 부자가 아니에요. 오히려 빚더미에 앉아 있어요.

en: He is not rich, but he is happy.
For all his riches, he is not quite contented.
ko: 재산이 그렇게 많은데도 딱히 만족하지 못해요.

en: Though he is rich, he is not happy.
He boasts of his wealth.
He is as generous as wealthy.
He seems to have been rich.
He seemed to have been rich.
He is rich and I am poor.
He is rich and, moreover, well-born.
I think him to be rich.
He must have been rich.
He was very rich, and therefore could buy a mansion.
ko: 걔는 엄청 부자라서 저택도 살 수 있었어.

en: He is said to be rich.
Though he is rich, he is unkind.
He is rich, but he is unkind.
He is rich but he is not happy.
He's rich, but he's not happy.
ko: 걔 돈은 많아도 안 행복해 보여.

en: Although he is rich he works very hard.
He has more money than taste.
Rich as he is, he is not contented.
He is rich and you are just as rich.

ko: 걔는 돈이 많다고 해서 딱히 더 행복해하진 않아.

en: He is rich, what is more, he is well-bred.
ko: 걔는 부자인 데다가 가정교육도 잘 받았어.

en: He is free with his money.
He left his safe in my care.
He stole my money from the safe.
ko: 걔가 내 금고에서 돈을 훔쳐 갔어.

en: He was accused of stealing money.
He said he would lend me some money, and he was as good as his word.
ko: 걔가 돈 빌려준다더니 정말 약속 지켰어.

en: He went in search of gold.
He is lavish with his money.

ko: 걔는 그 돈을 받는 바람에 사람들 신뢰를 잃었어.

en: In accepting the money, he lost the respect of the people.
ko: 걔는 돈을 챙기면서 사람들 존경을 잃었어.

en: He approached his uncle about lending him some money.
ko: 걔 삼촌한테 돈 좀 빌려달라고 얘기해봤대.

en: He slid the money into my pocket.
ko: 걔가 내 주머니에 돈을 슬쩍 찔러 넣었어.

en: He exhausted his money.

ko: 걔 돈으로 그 클럽에 들어가려고 했어.

en: He invested his money in stocks.

en: He said that he had a lot of money.

ko: 걔는 돈 모으려고 몇 년 동안 엄청 아끼며 살았어.

en: He worked hard to earn a lot of money.
ko: 걔 돈 많이 벌려고 진짜 열심히 일했어.

en: He asked for some money.

en: He has much money but few friends.
ko: 걔는 돈은 많은데 친구가 별로 없어.

en: He has a lot of money, but has almost no friends.
ko: 걔 돈은 진짜 많은데 친구는 거의 없어.

en: He is a rich but dull man.

en: He was wearing a gold necklace and a coat made of bird feathers.

en: He doesn't know what to do with his money.
ko: 걔는 돈을 어디다 써야 할지 모르나 봐.

en: He sold his party for money.

He'll do anything for money.
He doesn't give a fig about money.

en: He is liberal with his money and buys a lot of presents.
ko: 걔는 돈 아끼지 않고 선물도 많이 사 줘.

en: He said nothing as to money.
ko: 걔 돈 얘기는 한마디도 안 하더라.

en: He is very close with his money.
ko: 걔 돈 쓰는 거에 정말 인색해.

en: He is close with his money.
He sold his country for money.
He made a medal of gold.
He asked for the money.
He failed, due to lack of money.
He failed because he did not have money.

He had to give up the trip for lack of money.

ko: 걔 돈이 너무 많아서 다 쓰지도 못해.

en: He took great pains to find a shortcut.
He took a short cut.
He majors in modern literature.
He gets along well with the people in his neighborhood.
He is a cut above his neighbors.
He is getting along with his neighborhood.
He could not get along with his neighbors.
He was made a fool of by his neighbors.
I think he can get along with his neighbor.
ko: 걔 이웃이랑 잘 지낼 수 있을 것 같아.

en: He is a hard man to get at.
He criticizes a book recently published.
He is getting along with his employees.
I hear he is in bad health these days.
It is rumored that he will shortly resign.
He lived in a small town nearby.
He lived in a town near by.
He has been working out to develop his muscles.
He signed off from wine.
He renounced smoking and drinking.
He abstained from alcohol.
He is in bonds.
He vowed to give up smoking.
He stopped smoking.
He abstained from smoking.
He quit smoking.
He gave me his office telephone number and address.
He succeeded by virtue of diligence.
Diligence enabled him to succeed.
He gained the prize by dint of hard work.
He isn't a diligent student.
He is a diligent student. He studies three hours every day.
ko: 걔 성실한 학생이야. 매일 세 시간씩 공부해.

en: He is an industrious man.
Is he a hardworking student?
He is an industrious student.
I like him all the better for his diligence.
He is far from diligent.
He is neither diligent nor clever.
Hardworking as he was, sometimes he felt disinclined to study.
They say he is diligent.
I hear he is looking for work.
He was charged with a secret mission.
He is timid as a hare.
He's as timid as a rabbit.
He's very timid.
Because of his achievements, he is held in high esteem.
ko: 걔는 자기가 세운 업적 덕분에 아주 높게 평가받아.

en: Was he lying on his back?
He fell backward.
He lay on his back.
He was lying on his back, looking at the sky.
ko: 걔 똑바로 누워서 하늘 보고 있었어.

en: He lay face up.
He laid on his back and looked up at the sky.
He was lying on his back.
He laid on his back.
He lay down on his back.
He lifted the car with his phenomenal strength.
ko: 걔는 엄청난 힘으로 차를 들어 올렸어.

en: He was filled with wonder.
He started in surprise.
He cried out in alarm.
He looked at me in surprise.
He arched his eyebrows in surprise.
He picked up a mirror and examined his tongue.
He turned round from side to side to look at himself in the mirror.
ko: 걔 거울 보려고 이리저리 몸을 돌렸어.

en: Does he often call his parents at home?
ko: 걔 집으로 부모님께 전화 자주 해?

en: He couldn't restrain his excitement.
He could not restrain his excitement.
He sat down to recover from his agitation.
The more excited he got, the less talkative he became.
He is prone to getting excited.
He turned red with excitement.
He was flushed with excitement.
He was beside himself with excitement.
He felt patriotism rise in his breast.
He died from a wound in the chest after a week.
ko: 걔 가슴에 입은 상처 때문에 일주일 만에 죽었어.

en: He felt an acute pain in his chest.
He acted like a madman.
He acted like a lunatic.
He behaved like a madman.
He went into teaching.
He has long experience in teaching.
He has a lot of teaching experience.
He is not so much a professor as a TV star.
He ran into the classroom.
He slipped out of the classroom.
He earns his living by teaching.
He works as a teacher, but actually he is a spy.
He is better suited to a job as a teacher is.
ko: 걔는 선생님이라는 직업에 더 잘 어울려.

en: He is unfit to be a teacher.
He has decided to become a teacher.
He aspires to become a teacher.
He earned his living as a teacher.
He is eminent both as a teacher and writer.
He has little experience in teaching.
He is not so much a teacher as an entertainer.
He is not so much a teacher as a scholar.
He is a teacher and novelist.
He is not a teacher but a doctor.
He is not a teacher but a student.
He is not a teacher, much less a scholar.
ko: 선생님도 아닌데 학자는 말할 것도 없죠.

en: He is a teacher.
He's a teacher and so am I.
He's a textbook case.
He has had a long teaching career.
He proposed a reform in the educational system.
He found it difficult to live on his student grant.
He chose education for his career.
He introduced the problem of education into the conversation.
He holds an extreme opinion on education.
ko: 교육에 대해서 좀 극단적인 의견을 가지고 있어요.

en: He keeps harping on about declining standards in education.
ko: 교육 수준이 떨어지고 있다는 소리를 입에 달고 살아요.

en: He stated the importance of the education.
He placed emphasis on the importance of education.
He doesn't even know the elements of an education.
He is a man of education.
He is engaged in teaching.
He made himself immortal with a number of outstanding books about education.
ko: 교육에 관한 훌륭한 책들을 많이 써서 이름을 남겼어요.

en: He assimilated what he was taught.
ko: 배운 내용을 자기 것으로 잘 소화했어요.

en: He found that teaching was his calling.
What he was taught he mastered.
He mastered all he was taught.
He was guided by his fears.
He was paralyzed by fear.
He was seized with fear.
He had a look that mingled fright with surprise.
He was paralyzed with terror.
He turned pale with fear.
He turned pale with fright.
He has an enormous conceit.
He fell a victim to a deadly disease.
He prophesied that a dreadful calamity would happen.
Probably he wasn't just playing practical trick on us.
ko: 설마 그냥 우리한테 장난친 건 아니었을 거예요.

en: He was scared green.
ko: 얼굴이 사색이 될 정도로 겁을 먹었어요.

en: He defeated his powerful antagonists.
He had his hat blown off by the strong wind.
He was in prison on a charge of robbery.
He was sent to jail for the robbery.
He was arrested on the charge of burglary.
He was too obstinate, but on the other hand he was reliable.
He's a tough-minded owner.
He is a man of firm character.
He has strong principles.
He was far from robust.
So far from being robust, he was extremely weak.
He comes on strong.
ko: 그 사람은 좀 강하게 밀어붙이는 스타일이에요.

en: He looks strong.
He is strong, brave and, above all, kind.
ko: 걔는 힘도 세고 용감하고 무엇보다 친절해.

en: He has a strong body.
He has a strong mind.
He was dazzled by the bright light.
ko: 걔는 너무 밝은 빛에 눈이 부셨어.

en: He won the game thanks to his strong will.
ko: 걔는 강한 의지 덕분에 경기에서 이겼어.

en: He is powerful.
He's strong.
He is contented with his lot.
He began to shout.
He heard a shout.
He has investigated the possibility of cooperation.
He was considered an accomplice.
He was considered to be an accomplice.
They thought that he was an accomplice.
He often offends against our agreement.
He is training a horse for a race.
He knows better than to spend all his money on horse racing.
ko: 걔는 경마에 돈을 다 쓸 정도로 바보는 아니야.

en: He wasted his time on gambling at the horse races.
He watches for an opportunity to intrigue against his rival.
ko: 걔는 라이벌을 공격할 기회만 엿보고 있어.

en: He is superior to his competitors in everything.
He was traded, so to speak, to the rival firm.
ko: 걔는 말하자면 라이벌 회사로 트레이드된 셈이야.

en: He endeavored to win the contest.
He won the race easily.
He is studying at Kyoto University.
On arriving in Kyoto, he went home.
He may have left for Kyoto.
He had been there for ten years before he came to Kyoto.
ko: 교토에 오기 전에 걔는 거기 10년 동안 있었어.

en: He bought a small house in Kyoto.
He lives in Kyoto.
He is a fish dealer.
He is a fishmonger.
I think he makes money by selling fish.
ko: 내 생각에 걔는 생선 팔아서 돈을 버는 것 같아.

en: He caught three fish.
He is able to swim like a fish.
He can swim like a fish.
He has a passion for fishing.
He never goes out fishing without taking his son.
ko: 걔는 낚시 갈 때마다 아들을 꼭 데리고 가.

en: He doesn't like fish.
He inspired me with confidence.
He lives in an enormous house.
He fell asleep at the wheel and had an accident.
He dozed off.
He had long hair last year.
He was in good health last summer.
He has not written to us since last February.
ko: 걔 지난 2월부터 우리한테 편지를 안 썼어.

en: He stopped smoking last year.
He died of cancer last year.
He doesn't like beef. Neither do I.
ko: 걔는 소고기 안 좋아해. 나도 그래.

en: He has ten cows.
He learned how to raise cattle.
He exchanged his cow for two horses.
He breeds cattle and horses.
He demanded that his salary be increased.
He demanded that his salary should be increased right away.
He moved to a good company that offered a good salary.
ko: 월급 많이 주는 좋은 회사로 옮겼어.

en: He is always complaining about his low salary.
His salary is so small he must do odd jobs.
ko: 월급이 너무 쥐꼬리만 해서 잡다한 일을 해야 해.

en: His salary is low so he has to do odd jobs.
ko: 월급이 적어서 다른 일도 해야 해.

en: His salary is too low to support his family.
ko: 월급이 너무 적어서 가족을 부양하기 힘들어.

en: His salary is too low to support his family on.
ko: 월급이 너무 적어서 가족들 먹여 살리기가 힘들어.

en: He left a note to the effect that he was going out for lunch.
He rose from office boy to manager of the company.
He was the object of great admiration from his classmates.
ko: 반 친구들의 부러움을 한 몸에 받았어.

en: He exposed himself to the ridicule of his classmates.
He is on good terms with his classmates.
He was made fun of by his classmates.
He began to cry.
He started to cry.
He cried and cried.
He does not speak unless he is asked to.
He's beyond help.
He left for Tokyo on urgent business by the 7 o'clock express this morning.
ko: 오늘 아침 7시 급행열차 타고 급한 일로 도쿄에 갔어.

en: Urgent business kept him from coming.
He has gone to Osaka on urgent business.
Urgent business discouraged him from going on a picnic.
ko: 급한 일 때문에 소풍을 못 갔어.

en: He stopped short and looked back.
He stopped short.
He suddenly started writing a letter to his mother.
He suddenly fell ill.
He had to leave for Tokyo on short notice.
He fell into a rage.
He felt a sudden pain.
He burst into laughter.
He felt a sudden urge to write a novel.
ko: 갑자기 소설을 쓰고 싶다는 생각이 확 들었어.

en: He took it into his head to start the next morning.
ko: 다음 날 아침에 출발하기로 갑자기 마음먹었어.

en: He turned sharp left.
He made a sharp turn to the left.
He took a sharp left.
He up and beat me.
He changed his attitude suddenly.
He put his foot on the brake suddenly.
He hates being told to hurry up.
ko: 서두르라는 말 듣는 거 진짜 싫어해.

en: He went away in a hurry.
He had a hasty breakfast.
He is used to eating in a rush.
He went out in a hurry.
He put the phone down in haste.
He got into his car in a hurry.
He went to the airport in a hurry.
He hastily packed his bags.
He hurried to the house only to find that it was empty.
ko: 걔가 서둘러서 집에 갔는데 아무도 없더라고.

en: He hurried back from England.
He got out of the cab in haste.
It appears that he was in a hurry.
He enjoys reading novels on holiday.
ko: 걔는 쉴 때 소설 읽는 거 좋아해.

en: While resting, he listens to music.
He played golf day after day during his vacation.
He played golf every day during his vacation.
ko: 걔 휴가 동안 매일 골프 쳤어.

en: I wonder if he can lend me his guitar during the vacation.
ko: 걔가 휴가 때 기타 빌려줄 수 있을지 모르겠네.

en: He grew a beard while he was on holiday.
He is on leave.
He dropped in on some old friends during his vacation trip to New York.
ko: 걔 뉴욕 여행 갔을 때 옛날 친구들 좀 만났대.

en: He's had a holiday and looks all the better for it.
ko: 걔 휴가 다녀오더니 훨씬 좋아 보이더라.

en: He is away on holiday.
He cannot afford a holiday.
ko: 걔 휴가 갈 형편이 안 돼.

en: He never got a holiday.
ko: 걔는 휴가 한 번을 못 갔어.

en: He is planning to go home on leave.
ko: 걔 휴가 때 집에 갈 계획이래.

en: He's gone holidaying in the Mediterranean.
He is home on leave.
He needed to rest.
He has gone to Hawaii on vacation.
He phoned me to talk about his holiday plans.
He came to school after a long absence.
He returned home after a long absence.
He came tumbling down the hill.
He went down the hill.
He stood on the hill surveying the landscape.
ko: 걔 언덕 위에 서서 풍경을 구경했어.

en: He is standing on the hill.
He writes scripts.
He stood with his legs wide apart.
ko: 걔 다리를 쩍 벌리고 서 있었어.

en: He broke one of the bones in his leg.
He went to stay at his client's house.
ko: 걔 거래처 사람 집에서 묵기로 했대.

en: He killed time in a coffee shop watching girls pass by.
ko: 걔 카페에서 지나가는 여자들 구경하면서 시간 때웠어.

en: He started an argument for smoking.
ko: 걔 담배 피우는 것 때문에 시비 붙었어.

en: He gave up cigarettes.
He has stopped smoking.
He broke himself of the bad habit of smoking.
ko: 걔 담배 피우는 나쁜 습관 고쳤어.

en: He is not the kind of person who is open to discussion.
He never gets into an argument without losing his temper.
ko: 걔는 말싸움만 하면 꼭 화를 내더라.

en: He cannot argue without losing his temper.
ko: 걔는 화 안 내고는 말싸움을 못 해.

en: He acted as chairman.
He accepted his appointment as chairman.
He addressed himself to the chairman.
He talked to the chairman.
He talked to the chairperson.
He was appointed chairman.
He was elected chairman.
He came forward as a candidate for Congress.
He is in the House.
He was blamed for neglect of duty.
ko: 걔는 할 일을 제대로 안 해서 비난받았어.

en: He is very observant of his duties.
ko: 걔는 자기 의무를 아주 잘 지켜.
